Line0.name: Child
Line0.dialogue: Mama says that she wishes the train would just start already

Option0.Head: And what do you wish for?

Line0.name: Child
Line0.dialogue: I'm just happy to be on the train my daddy worked on

Line2.name: Child
Line2.dialogue: I like trains and stories, and stories about trains

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: Do you now? I work on the railway myself

Line5.name: Child
Line5.dialogue: I'd love to work on a train when i'm older, just like my daddy did

Line7.name: Child
Line7.dialogue: he was super brave and cool, he would run on the roofs of trains to brake them, so they wouldn't crash

Line8.name: Child
Line8.dialogue: his job was very important, i bet i could do it too, just wait and see when i'm older

Option0.Head: And where's your dad now? He sounds cool

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Yep, your a wee lad still, your in perfect age to start working if you really want to

Line2.name: Child
Line2.dialogue: my mama says i'm still to small for that

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: hi mister old cat sir, mama says you look nice

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: Tell her that so does she, but guess what son

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: What?

Option0.Head: I recently made an new friend

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: really? who is he?

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: a future big name writer, he wants you to be the first to hear his stories

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: REALLY!? Let's get going then

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: yeah right, with whom if i may ask?

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: with a future award winning novelist, and right now THE best story writer ever

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: he wants you to be the first boy, girl, man, woman, or thing ever to hear his new stories

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: let's go then!!

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: that piece of garbage just jumped from the train and left us downhill to crash

Line1.name: Child
Line1.dialogue: what are we going to do?

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: we're gonna have to brake it

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: i'll need your help, you stop half and i'll stop the other half

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: we'll need to do it quickly, let's go

Option1.Head: Help me with your mama and i'll consider us even

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: Sure thing

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: I don't think i need to do much

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: She's already very much fond of you

Line0.dialogue: When will this infernal train finally start moving?

Line1.dialogue: someone should go awaken the man who makes the train go choo choo

Option0.Head: I'll wait for you right here

Option1.Head: I'm on my way over there right now

Line0.dialogue: you sir are a true hero, i'll write my next story about you

Line1.name: Writer
Line1.dialogue: it'll be a homage so wonderfull that all my readers will know your name!

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: so your a writer? have i read anything of yours?

Line2.name: Writer
Line2.dialogue: i don't believe, unless you really like childrens books

Line3.name: Writer
Line3.dialogue: but i'm on my way of writing my novel, so be sure to read it when it comes out

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: i'll be sure to do that

Line6.name: Writer
Line6.dialogue: i have to put food on the table somehow while i write my novel

Line7.name: Writer
Line7.dialogue: if that means humiliating myself by writing for children, then by the grace of God it shall be

Line8.name: Snowball
Line8.dialogue: so you don't like what you do?

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Hello there, you know, there's a kid on board who seems nice, and really likes trains

Line8.name: Snowball
Line8.dialogue: He's quite sad looking right now, can i bring him over? you tell him a story and cheer him up, that sort of thing

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: I despise myself for what i do for a living, i should be writing novels

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: I should be respected by literary scholars around the globe

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: But instead i write books for children because my novels don't circulate

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: And now you want me to be some sort of jester for a child

Option0.Head: Don't think of it as that, consider it more focus group of your future readers

Option1.Head: Come on man, he's like REALLY sad

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: Feed him some simplified ideas and see what happens

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: Hmm

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: Fine, i'll test some stuff with him, send him over when ever

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: So am i, and nobody gives me sympathy, only ridicule

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: But fine, i'll help the kid out

Line0.name: Writer
Line0.dialogue: Well look at that, you did bring him

Line1.name: Writer
Line1.dialogue: You ready to listen to my genius?

Line2.name: Child
Line2.dialogue: I think i will be the judge of that

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: Are you good here little man?

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: I can stay if you want

Line5.name: Child
Line5.dialogue: I'm good, you can go do other stuff if you want

Line6.name: Snowball
Line6.dialogue: You can take care of him right?

Line7.name: Writer
Line7.dialogue: Of course, i'll just send him out the door and in your direction once i'm gone

Line0.name: Writer
Line0.dialogue: I really really liked that young man

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Quite a smart lad isn't he?

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: Oh i just came for the boy, his mother started to get nervous

Line6.name: Writer
Line6.dialogue: I sent him off a while ago

Line8.name: Snowball
Line8.dialogue: His mother will have my head

Line9.name: Writer
Line9.dialogue: I saw him leave my wagon, after that i'm lost

Option0.Head: I'll have to tell his mother, maybe she has an idea of were he could be

Option1.Head: His mother can't know this, i'll have to hurry and make something up

Line0.name: Writer
Line0.dialogue: I guess now your a real hero

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Not even close, but you still owe a story to my name, make it interisting now

Line2.name: Writer
Line2.dialogue: I'll try and do you justice
